item.title: Windsor has created much-needed disruption in EV market: Parth Jindal - Business Standard
item.description:
Windsor Disruption Boosts EV Sales, Says Parth Jindal

Publication Date: October 2024 | Source: Business Standard

Windsor, launched in September 2024, has successfully disrupted the electric vehicle (EV) market, according to Parth Jindal, Director of JSW MG Motor India.

The new model helped JSW MG Motor’s sales rise significantly while overall market growth was modest, showcasing its impact.

  • JSW MG Motor's sales grew 35% YoY to 20,580 units in Q4 2024.
  • Overall EV industry sales increased by only 5.4% YoY to 1.07 million units.
  • The MG Windsor aims to democratize electric mobility on Indian roads.
  • Electric car sales for JSW MG Motor doubled in 2024.
  • JSW’s market share in Indian electric car sales increased from 11.5% in 2023 to 21.66% in 2024.
  • Tata Motors’ market share declined from 72.68% to 62% over the same period.
“With several new launches planned, we are confident of surpassing previous benchmarks.” – Parth Jindal

This disruption in the EV market reflects a significant shift as consumers embrace more affordable and innovative electric vehicles.

item.title: Elon Musk's Grok diagnoses fracture missed by doctors, US woman claims in viral post - India Today
item.description:
Elon Musk's Grok diagnoses fracture missed by doctors, US woman claims in viral post

Published On: Jan 12, 2025 | Published By: Akshita Singh

A US-based woman claimed that Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, correctly identified her daughter's fracture -- something medical professionals reportedly missed. The revelation, shared in a post on X, has sparked debate over AI's potential role in healthcare.

  • AJ Kay reported her daughter was in a serious car accident, appearing unscathed initially.
  • Doctors, after examination and X-rays, diagnosed no fracture and sent her home with painkillers.
  • Concerned by worsening symptoms, Kay turned to Grok for a second opinion, uploading the X-ray images.
  • Grok identified a clear fracture line in the distal radius.
  • A wrist specialist confirmed the diagnosis and warned of potential surgery if treatment was delayed.
  • The incident has ignited discussions about AI's role in healthcare, with mixed reactions from the public.
“There's a clear fracture line in the distal radius.” - Grok

This incident highlights the potential benefits and concerns surrounding the integration of AI in medical diagnosis, proving to be both a cautionary tale and a groundbreaking moment for AI in healthcare.

item.title: Trade setup for January 13: Top 15 things to know before the opening bell - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Trade setup for January 13: Top 15 things to know before the opening bell

Date: January 12, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Nifty 50 extended its downtrend for the third consecutive session, falling 0.4 percent with above-average volumes on January 10. If Friday's low (23,350) is broken, the Nifty 50 may test the November low of 23,263, followed by 23,000, which is the key support zone.

  • The 23,600-23,700 range is crucial for bulls to regain momentum.
  • The overall trend remains bearish, indicated by negative momentum indicators.
"If Friday's low (23,350) is broken, the Nifty 50 may test the November low of 23,263, followed by 23,000, which is the key support zone." - Market Experts

In conclusion, traders should be cautious as the Nifty remains below key moving averages, and the upcoming levels are indicative of possible market movement.

item.description:
Stocks to Buy Under ₹100: Sumeet Bagadia Recommends Three Shares

Date: January 13, 2025
Source: Live Mint

The Indian markets are seeing a continued sell-off, with bearish sentiment prevailing and the Nifty 50 closing below the key 23,500 level. Sumeet Bagadia has recommended three stocks under ₹100 that may present buying opportunities.

Sumeet Bagadia's Stock Recommendations

  • Lloyds Engineering Works: Momentum buy at ₹83.26, Stop Loss of ₹80; Target Price of ₹90.
  • NACL Industries: Momentum buy at ₹68.39, Stop Loss of ₹65; Target Price of ₹73.
  • Jain Irrigation Systems: Momentum buy at ₹73.93, Stop Loss of ₹71; Target Price of ₹79.

Disclaimer: The views and recommendations provided in this analysis are those of individual analysts or broking companies, not Mint. We strongly advise investors to consult with certified experts before making any investment decisions, as market conditions can change rapidly and individual circumstances may vary.

item.title: TCS expects margin benefits as BSNL deal tapers; to create 25K-seat capacity in Bengaluru: CFO | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
TCS Anticipates Margin Growth Amid BSNL Deal Tapering and Plans for 25K New Seats in Bengaluru

Date: January 12, 2023 | Source: PTI

TCS's CFO, Samir Seksaria, highlights expected margin benefits as the BSNL deal tapers off, along with plans to expand operational capacity in Bengaluru.

  • Tapering of the BSNL deal expected to positively affect TCS margins.
  • Company plans to create a capacity of over 25,000 seats in Bengaluru.
  • Current operating profit margin stands at 24.5% for the December quarter.
  • TCS will compensate for the tapering BSNL revenue through other sources.
  • Plans to enter the aspirational profit margin band of 26-28% by FY26.
  • Company manages financial impacts of currency fluctuations via an active hedging program.
“The same program (BSNL) as it tapers down at a portfolio level, at an overall level, there would be a benefit which would come in (on margins)” - Samir Seksaria, CFO

The expansion plans and efficiencies expected from the tapering BSNL deal signal optimistic growth for TCS and its commitment to enhancing operational capacities in a competitive IT market.

item.title: Woman Claims Elon Musk's Grok Detected Her Daughter's Fracture After Doctors Fail To Diagnose It - NDTV
item.description:
AI Chatbot Grok Identifies Fracture After Misdiagnosis by Doctors

Publication Date: January 11, 2025

Source: Twitter (X)

A mother claims that Elon Musk's AI chatbot, Grok, successfully diagnosed her daughter's fracture after medical professionals failed to do so following a car accident. This incident raises questions about AI's role in healthcare.

  • AJ Kay's daughter was in a car accident and initially evaluated by medical professionals.
  • Despite being told there were no fractures, the daughter's symptoms worsened, prompting further investigation.
  • Using Grok, the AI identified a fracture that was missed in earlier assessments.
  • A wrist specialist later confirmed Grok's diagnosis, emphasizing the importance of timely treatment.
  • The case has sparked discussions about the reliability of AI in diagnosing medical issues.
“True story: @Grok diagnosed my daughter's broken wrist last week.” — AJ Kay

This case highlights the potential of AI in providing second opinions in medical diagnostics, though it also poses questions about reliance on technology versus human expertise.

item.title: Quadrant Future IPO GMP falls ahead of listing; here's what it means | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Quadrant Future IPO GMP falls ahead of listing; here’s what it means

Publication Date: January 10

Source: Live Mint

The Quadrant Future initial public offering (IPO) received overwhelming interest, being subscribed 186.66 times by investors. However, the grey market premium (GMP) has fallen significantly ahead of its listing.

  1. The IPO allotment was finalized on January 10, with a subscription rate of 186.66 times.
  2. The retail investor segment subscribed 246.94 times, while the non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 254.71 times.
  3. Expected listing date is January 14, with an estimated listing price of ₹435, 50% higher than the IPO price.
  4. GMP has declined from ₹190 on allotment day to ₹145.
  5. The IPO is a fresh issue of ₹290 crore, with proceeds used for capital expenditures and debt repayment.
“The grey market premium (GMP) is the price at which an IPO is traded in an unofficial/unregulated grey market prior to its listing.”

The recent drop in GMP raises questions about investor sentiment leading up to Quadrant Future's market debut.

item.title: Standard Glass IPO shares to list on Jan 13; analysts recommend buy, sell or hold strategy - Moneycontrol

item.title: "My Wife Loves Staring At Me": Adar Poonawalla Mocks L&T Chief's Remark - NDTV
item.description:
"My Wife Loves Staring At Me": Adar Poonawalla Mocks L&T Chief's Remark

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: NDTV

Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla comments on work-life balance, supporting the sentiment that quality of work is more important than quantity, in response to controversial remarks from L&T Chairman SN Subrahmanyan.

  • Poonawalla emphasizes quality over quantity in work hours on social media.
  • His comment follows Mahindra's remarks about work output versus hours logged.
  • Subrahmanyan suggests employees should work 90 hours a week, sparking backlash.
  • Critics, including Jwala Gutta and Harsh Goenka, label Subrahmanyan's comments as harmful and unrealistic.
  • The debate around work-life balance highlights differing perspectives among industry leaders.

"Why shouldn't he stare at his wife... and why only on a Sunday?" - Jwala Gutta

The ongoing discussion illustrates the tensions between work expectations and personal life, emphasizing the importance of sustainable work practices.

item.title: Beware: 90-hour workweek is nothing; companies are now hiring detectives to check if you're unwell during sick leaves | Company Business News - Mint
item.description:
Companies Hire Detectives to Monitor Sick Leave Amid 90-Hour Workweek Debate

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Agence France-Presse

As sick leave practices come under scrutiny in Germany, companies are hiring detectives to confirm employee illnesses. This trend reflects concerns about high absenteeism rates during a national economic slump.

  • Growing number of companies checking employee sick leave legitimacy.
  • High absenteeism rates have led to economic concerns in Germany.
  • Calls for a 90-hour workweek by business leaders in India spark debate.
  • Data shows Germans missed an average of 6.8% of working hours due to illness in 2023.
“If someone has 30, 40 or sometimes up to 100 sick days in a year, then at some point they become economically unattractive for the employer.” - Marcus Lentz

This increasing scrutiny of sick leave highlights the lengths companies will go to manage absenteeism and the tensions between employee welfare and business interests.

item.title: On L&T Chief's 90-Hour Workweek Call, Adar Poonawalla Says 'Even My Wife...' - News18
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: ITC allots 125.11 crore shares of ITC Hotels to shareholders - The Economic Times
item.description:
ITC Allocates 125.11 Crore Shares of ITC Hotels to Shareholders

Publication Date: January 11, 2025 Source: The Economic Times

ITC Ltd. has allotted 125.11 crore equity shares to its shareholders as part of a demerger, creating ITC Hotels as an independent entity. This strategic move aims to unlock value in the hospitality sector and is expected to enhance capital allocation.

  • 125.11 crore equity shares allotted during a Board meeting on January 11, 2025.
  • ITC Hotels is now India’s second-largest hotel chain.
  • The demerger aims to attract investors and improve capital allocation strategies.
  • ITC will retain 40% of the hotel shares, with 60% distributed among shareholders.
  • ITC Hotels plans to apply for a listing of its shares post-regulatory approval.
“The demerger will help the hotels business in attracting appropriate investors and strategic partners.”

The demerger is a significant restructuring effort under the Companies Act, 2013, positioning ITC Hotels for growth in the hospitality sector.

item.title: 36000% return multibagger stock: Rs 10000 multiplies to Rs 36 lakh! Back-to-back upper circuit - ET Now
item.description:
36000% return multibagger stock: Rs 10000 multiplies to Rs 36 lakh! Back-to-back upper circuit

Date: Updated Jan 12, 2025 | Source: ET NOW Digital

Introduction: Vantage Knowledge Academy has emerged as a standout performer in the Indian stock market, showcasing an extraordinary return of 36000% over the past five years.

  • The company's stock has increased substantially, with a market cap of Rs 2,596.35 crore.
  • In the last six months, the stock has rallied over 380%.
  • A mere Rs 10,000 investment in 2020 would now be worth Rs 36 lakh.
  • The firm is planning to issue a dividend of Re 0.10 per share and a bonus share issue of 2:1.
“An investment of Rs 10,000 in January 2020 would yield Rs 36 lakh today.”

Conclusion: Vantage Knowledge Academy's remarkable growth and forthcoming dividend and bonus share issuance exemplify the potential for significant returns in the stock market, but investors are encouraged to consult financial advisors.

item.title: Nifty Prediction January 2025: RSI in negative crossover; selling to continue? Check support, resistance levels by experts - ET Now
item.description:
Nifty Prediction January 2025: RSI in Negative Crossover Indicates Continued Selling

Updated Jan 12, 2025 by ET NOW News

Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex have experienced a significant decline, attributed to sustained foreign fund outflows that have eroded investor confidence.

  • Sensex is down 10% and Nifty plunged 10.8% from their record highs.
  • The RSI indicator shows a negative crossover, suggesting weak market momentum.
  • A staggering Rs 13.51 lakh crore has been lost in three sessions of selling.
“A reasonable negative candle was formed on the daily chart with minor lower shadow, indicating continuation of weakness in the market.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst

This ongoing market trend highlights ongoing investor concerns, primarily due to economic forecasts and global financial pressures.

item.title: Los Angeles fire evacuees face price gouging - The Hindu
item.description:
Los Angeles Fire Evacuees Face Price Gouging Amid Crisis

Date: January 12, 2025 Source: AFP

Five days after wildfires devastated Los Angeles, evacuees are struggling with exorbitant rental prices due to price gouging by landlords.

  • More than 150,000 people have been ordered to evacuate as wildfires wreak havoc across the city.
  • Some landlords have raised rental prices exorbitantly, challenging desperate evacuees seeking shelter.
  • California's Attorney General warns that price gouging is illegal and violators could face jail time.
  • The situation is exacerbated by a shortage of available housing as many properties were destroyed or rendered uninhabitable.
"Price gouging is illegal. We will not stand for it... those found guilty could land themselves a year in jail." - Attorney General Rob Bonta

The ongoing wildfires and subsequent price gouging create a dire situation for many residents, highlighting issues of housing security in crisis circumstances.

item.title: Production-spec Hyundai Creta Electric First Look, Exterior And Interior Detailed In 16 Real-life Images - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric: First Look and Detailed Features

Publication Date: January 17 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Hyundai Creta Electric is poised to become the most affordable electric vehicle from Hyundai India. This article showcases the exterior and interior features of the Creta Electric through 16 real-life images.

Key Features:

  • Closed-off grille with pixelated elements.
  • Preserves silhouette and window lines of the standard Creta.
  • New 17-inch aero-styled alloy wheels.
  • Interior features a dual-tone theme, new steering wheel, and roomy storage space.
  • Offers two battery pack options: 42 kWh with a range of 390 km and 51.4 kWh with 473 km range.
  • Charging capability: DC fast charger charges 10-80% in 58 minutes.
  • Expected pricing starting from Rs 17 lakh, competing with Tata Curvv EV, Mahindra BE 6, and MG ZS EV.

Notable Statistics:

“The Creta Electric's battery packs can be fully charged using an AC charger in approximately 4 hours.”

This launch underscores Hyundai's commitment to the electric market and aims to attract a broad customer base looking for affordable EV options.

item.title: Nifty Prediction for Monday, Jan 13: BEARISH sentiments high? Here's what experts say - ET Now
item.description:
Nifty Prediction for Monday, Jan 13: BEARISH sentiments high? Here's what experts say

Updated Jan 12, 2025, 12:06 IST

Indian benchmark indices, Sensex and Nifty, extended their losing streak for the third consecutive session on January 10, with significant losses in market value due to persistent foreign fund outflows.

  • The market saw a loss of Rs 13.51 lakh crore over January 8-10.
  • The Sensex has dropped 8,600 points (10%) and the Nifty 50 has declined by 2,850 points (10.8%) from recent highs.
  • Analysts foresee a bearish trend continuing amid uncertainty regarding political developments and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors.
  • Support levels to watch are around 23260-23000, with resistance observed at 23600 levels.
“In the context of the looming uncertainty regarding President Trump’s likely actions, the market is unlikely to rally in the near-term.” - Dr VK Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist, Geojit Financial Services.

The market is in a correction phase, and experts advise caution as bearish sentiments prevail.

item.title: Week ahead: Inflation data, Q3 earnings among key market triggers as NIFTY50 nears 23,000 support level - Upstox
item.description:
Market Update: NIFTY50 Faces Pressure Amidst Earnings Season and Inflation Data

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Upstox

Markets experienced a downturn as NIFTY50 dropped below key support levels. Key market movers include inflation data and upcoming earnings announcements from major firms.

  • NIFTY50 index declined over 2%, breaking a two-week-up trend.
  • Mid and small-cap indices faced significant selling pressure, with NIFTY Midcap 100 down over 5% and Smallcap 100 more than 7%.
  • Sector performance was largely negative, with IT sector as the only gainer (+2.0%).
  • Foreign Institutional Investors (FIIs) show continued bearish positioning with an 82% short ratio in index futures.
  • Upcoming U.S. inflation data and quarterly earnings reports are expected to affect market sentiment.
  • NIFTY50's critical support zone is identified between 23,000-23,200; a dip below could further extend the decline.
"The NIFTY50 index broke out of a two-week consolidation, ending the week below the previous week's low, indicating increased weakness."

Investors are advised to stay cautious and monitor the critical support around the 23,000 mark which may dictate future market movements.

item.title: Market cap of five of top-10 most-valued firms tumbles ₹1.85 lakh crore; HDFC Bank hit hard | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Market cap of five of top-10 most-valued firms tumbles ₹1.85 lakh crore; HDFC Bank hit hard

Date: Not specified

Source: Live Mint

The combined market capitalization of five of the top-10 most-valued companies decreased significantly last week, primarily impacting HDFC Bank, amidst a downturn in the stock market.

This article highlights the major market fluctuations affecting leading companies, specifically noting HDFC Bank's notable losses in market capitalization.

  • The combined market cap of five top companies fell by ₹1,85,952.31 crore.
  • HDFC Bank suffered the largest drop in valuation, losing ₹70,479.23 crore.
  • The BSE Sensex fell by 1,844.2 points (2.32%).
  • Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) and others gained, countering the trend.
“HDFC Bank's valuation declined by ₹70,479.23 crore, settling at ₹12,67,440.61 crore.”

The significant decline in market capitalization reflects broader market trends and impacts on investor sentiment.

item.title: Are you a senior citizen? Don't miss out on these special fixed deposit (FD) schemes by SBI, IDBI, Indian Bank & others. | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Special Fixed Deposit Schemes for Senior Citizens by SBI, IDBI, and Indian Bank

Publication Date: Not stated Source: Live Mint

Senior citizens can take advantage of attractive fixed deposit (FD) schemes from various banks offering higher interest rates specifically designed for them.

  • SBI's Amrit Kalash Scheme: Offers 7.10% p.a for general citizens and 7.60% p.a for senior citizens for a tenure of 400 days.
  • SBI's Amrit Vrishti Scheme: Provides 7.25% p.a for general public and 7.75% p.a for senior citizens for a tenure of 444 days.
  • SBI Patrons FD Scheme: Designed for super senior citizens (aged 80+), offering rates slightly higher than regular senior citizen rates.
  • IDBI Bank's Utsav Callable FD: Interest rates of 7.40% p.a for general citizens and 7.90% p.a for senior citizens with a 555-day maturity.
  • IDBI Chiranjeevi FD: Rates of 7.90% p.a for super senior citizens on 375-day FD.
  • Indian Bank’s IND Supreme 300 & IND Super 400: Offers 7.05% to 8.05% p.a depending on the deposit and the age category.
  • Punjab & Sind Bank: Special FD schemes with a variety of tenures from 222 to 999 days.

item.title: Adani Total Gas and NHPC among 11 stocks that will lose largecap status - The Economic Times
item.description:
Adani Total Gas and NHPC Among 11 Stocks Losing Largecap Status

Date: Jan 12, 2025 Source: Economic Times

The Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) announced a stock re-categorization that will result in 11 large-cap stocks losing their status due to new market cap thresholds effective February 2025.

  • AMFI has updated the large-cap cut-off to Rs 1 lakh crore.
  • The mid-cap threshold is now set at around Rs 33,200 crore.
  • Stocks moving from large-cap to mid-cap include Adani Total Gas, NHPC, IDBI Bank, and others.
“Based on current average market-cap levels, these changes highlight the evolving nature of market categorization,” stated Nuvama Alternative Research.

This re-categorization reflects significant shifts in the market and will impact various investors and mutual fund allocations.

item.title: VinFast VF7, VF9 electric SUVs set for Bharat Mobility Expo debut: What to expect - The Times of India
item.description:
VinFast VF7, VF9 electric SUVs set for Bharat Mobility Expo debut: What to expect

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

VinFast is ready to unveil its latest electric SUVs, the VF7 and VF9, at the Bharat Mobility Expo. This marks a significant step for the company as it expands its footprint in the Indian electric vehicle market.

  • The VF7 and VF9 will feature advanced electric technology aimed at providing efficient and sustainable transportation.
  • VinFast aims to compete with existing electric vehicle manufacturers in India.
  • The expo serves as a platform for promoting electric mobility in the country.
"VinFast is committed to revolutionizing electric transportation in India." - [VinFast Executive]

The Bharat Mobility Expo is expected to be a pivotal point for VinFast as it enters the strategic Indian market, showcasing innovation in electric vehicles.

item.title: Q3 results: RIL, Infosys, HCL Tech, Wipro, Tech Mahindra among companies to declare earnings next week; check full list | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Q3 results: RIL, Infosys, HCL Tech, Wipro, Tech Mahindra among companies to declare earnings next week; check full list

Publication Date: January 10, 2023 Source: Live Mint

The third quarter earnings season is underway, with major companies set to announce their results from January 13 to January 17, impacting investor strategy and market dynamics.

  • Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) already released results on January 9.

As the earnings season progresses, investors will be keenly watching these financial disclosures for insights into the health of major sectors.

item.title: Jio offers YouTube Premium free for 2 years with JioFiber and AirFiber: Check out plans - The Indian Express
item.description:
Jio Offers YouTube Premium Free for 2 Years with JioFiber and AirFiber

Date: January 11, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

Jio is enhancing its JioFiber and Jio AirFiber plans by offering YouTube Premium for free for two years to users. This offer allows users to enjoy an ad-free experience on the platform, improving the viewing of videos significantly.

  • Free YouTube Premium for 24 months with JioFiber and Jio AirFiber.
  • Ad-free viewing experience without interruptions from ads.
  • Ability to listen to videos in the background while multitasking.
  • Offline video downloads and access to YouTube Music included.
  • Targets individuals and households using broadband and smart TV extensively.
“Enjoy ad-free YouTube on your big screen with JioAirFiber & JioFiber. Get 24 months of YouTube Premium today.” — Reliance Jio

This initiative aims to boost Jio's broadband experience as well as attract more postpaid users by adding significant value at no extra cost.

item.title: Reliance Power, Infra shareholding: Anil Ambani, son Jai Anmol to reclassify their status – Details - ET Now
item.description:
Anil Ambani and Jai Anmol to Reclassify Shareholding Status in Reliance Power and Infra

Updated on January 12, 2025, by ET Now

Anil Ambani and his son Jai Anmol A Ambani are set to reclassify their shareholding status from promoters to public shareholders, as informed by their firms Reliance Power and Infrastructure.

  • Anil Ambani and son Jai Anmol Ambani announced the reclassification of their shares.
  • Anil Ambani holds 4,65,792 shares in Reliance Power and 1,39,437 shares in Reliance Infra.
  • Jai Anmol holds 4,17,439 shares in Reliance Power and 1,25,231 shares in Reliance Infra.
  • The board reviewed the applications to comply with listing regulations.
  • Current rules mandate that promoter voting rights should not exceed 10% for reclassification.
“...and noted that the same are in compliance with provisions of Regulation 31A of the Listing Regulations.”

This decision may lead to new price movements in the shares of Reliance Power and Infrastructure.
